page.title: 17Land Use
page.content: In general the whole of the land use within the area, excluding the town itself, is agricultural, with a portion of woodland. All the land to the East of the river, trapped between it and the sandstone hills forms very rich agricultural land. All other land in the area being above this plane is formed from more shallow sandy soil.In many places the natural sandstone lies no more than a few inches below the surface, limiting the types of crops to be grown. Most of the woodland in the area is formed from coniferous type timber, with the exception of the odd remains of the old Forest of Morfe.Most of the land belongs to one of two large historically based estates, both of which whilst keeping abreast of modern methods are aware of their responsibilities to the area.
